edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge
Class ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenVerifier

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.zeroKnowledge.ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenVerifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
ZKPOKVerifier, ZKVerifier
public class ZKPOKFromSigmaCmtPedersenVerifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements ZKPOKVerifier

Concrete implementation of Zero Knowledge verifier.

This is a transformation that takes any Sigma protocol and any perfectly hiding trapdoor (equivocal) commitment scheme and yields a zero-knowledge proof of knowledge.

For more information see Protocol 6.5.4, page 165 of Hazay-Lindell.

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 2.2 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Method Detail

verify

public boolean verify(ZKCommonInput input)
               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      CheatAttemptException
Runs the verifier side of the Zero Knowledge proof.

Let (a,e,z) denote the prover1, verifier challenge and prover2 messages of the sigma protocol.

This function computes the following calculations:

SAMPLE a random challenge e <- {0, 1^t

RUN TRAP_COMMIT.commit as the committer with input e

WAIT for a message a from P

RUN TRAP_COMMIT.decommit as the decommitter

WAIT for a message (z,trap) from P

IF

• TRAP_COMMIT.valid(T,trap) = 1, where T is the transcript from the commit phase, AND

• Transcript (a, e, z) is accepting in sigma on input x

OUTPUT ACC

ELSE

OUTPUT REJ

Specified by:
verify in interface ZKVerifier
Parameters:
input - must be an instance of SigmaCommonInput.
Returns:
true if the proof was verified; false, otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given input is not an instance of SigmaCommonInput
CheatAttemptException - in case the verifier suspects the prover is trying to cheat.
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem during the communication.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem during the serialization mechanism.
